Author: AMV
Review Text:
Personally have had from other outlets, maybe twice or thrice. I’m a vegetarian so only option into Biryani is the Paneer Variant. We ordered the Paneer ghee roast & Paneer Biryani. The ghee roast’s paneer was not upto the mark, the paneer didn’t seem fresh. The rice of the biryani was unusually too dry.

We were happy there is a new outlet, now so nearby, but the quality seemed compromised!
Please improve.

Author: Suraj Kumar
Review Text: Ordered food from here. Worst quality, found stone

Author: Kousik Barik
Review Text: I ordered Chicken boneless briyani and meghana special biriyani it's was amazing taste and good quality and quantity for the first time ordering Meghana foods Kanakapura road food was amazing I love meghana since 2008....

Author: anupam 013
Review Text: I have ordered meghana special chicken biryani but taste was not at all good. As I love meghana biryani a lot but after having biryani from here I thought not to order again.

Author: Soumya Tripathy
Review Text:
Meghna special Biryani rice was not good. My family members felt sick after having it yesterday.

Somehow this outlet doesn’t have the charm of Meghna foods. taste and quality is not on par. Now I’m thinking to avoid Meghna foods.

Author: Sridhar Siri
Review Text: I just took 2 biryani and chicken parcel, biryani was too tangy... Not at all good to eat.

Author: Yugi P
Review Text: I had high expectations from Meghana Biryani, but honestly, the taste was very disappointing. The biryani lacked authentic flavor – it felt bland rather than rich and balanced. The spices didn’t blend well,. For the price, I expected much better quality and taste. Overall, it did not meet and I wouldn’t recommend it.

Author: Vikram
Review Text: I took box meghanas special biryani and tbh I quantity of chicken pieces is very less for the price. Instead of giving so much raita and gravy, add extra pcs of chicken. This portion is very good for one person serving but little on a expensive side.

Author: Srinivas Bhat
Review Text: Tried Aloo dum biryani. Exceptionally good.

Author: Amit Nishti
Review Text: Food tastes as same as other branches, No parking and only take away opened as of now.

Personally have had from other outlets, maybe twice or thrice. I’m a vegetarian so only option into Biryani is the Paneer Variant. We ordered the Paneer ghee roast & Paneer Biryani. Review Text: Ordered food from here. Worst quality, found stone

Author: Srinivas Bhat
Review Text: Tried Aloo dum biryani. Exceptionally good.

Author: Amit Nishti
Review Text: Food tastes as same as other branches, No parking and only take away opened as of now.

Author: alexjoyluke
Review Text:
Exceptional Service and Great Food – A Truly Royal Experience at Koramangala Branch

I would rate their service 6 out of 5 – it was simply outstanding! I don’t recall the server’s name, but he was incredible. The attention to detail was next-level. For example, when our water bottles ran out, he replaced them instantly without us even asking. Despite being busy, he made sure we got our balance portions just before clearing the last scoop from the plate – that level of attentiveness is rare.

Even the person who took our order displayed excellent etiquette and hygiene. We had ordered a Coca-Cola can, and he opened it using tissue to cover his hand – a level of cleanliness and customer care I haven’t seen elsewhere.

I’ve been to their branches in Marathahalli, Indiranagar, JP Nagar, and Koramangala, and I must say Koramangala stands out for its exceptional service. The little things they do make a big difference. We genuinely felt like royalty – hats off to the team!

Food Review:

Prawns Ghee Roast – 4/5
Very good in taste, but I’ve had slightly better versions in Kochi and coastal areas. Still worth trying.

Mutton Dum Biryani – 4.5/5
Excellent flavors, tender and well-cooked mutton, soft rice – definitely a must-try!

Special Boneless Chicken Biryani – 4/5
As expected, very good and flavorful, but the mutton biryani still wins.

Special Lemon Chicken – 3.5/5
Good taste, but not exceptional. Personally, I prefer their regular Lemon Chicken, which is outstanding.

Author: chetan desai
Review Text:
Ever since I moved to Namma Bengaluru to live my life, the name Meghana has always been associated with the biryani. It’s like they are synonyms.

Despite of being pure vegetarians, I and my friend often visit Meghana’s to enjoy their vegetarian biriyanis ( some of the people argue that there’s nothing called vegetarian biryani, it’s just pulav, I don’t care, they have got it on their menu).

Visited this Koramangala branch of this franchise for our Thursday lunch. I always prefer air conditioned rooms to dine in especially in summers, we were directed to 2nd floor.

Since it was a weekday’s , the restaurant wasn’t that crowded, infact we were the first one to arrive in AC seating area.

We were proved with menus, but we had already decided what to eat, so we chose 2 biryanis from available 4 options.
Paneer biryani &
Aloo dum biryani
We also ordered a sprite and a butter milk.

We got the order within few minutes.
First we were served with paneer biryani, no doubt this biryani being the star dish of the Meghana’s (vegetarian section),
The flavourful rice’s served with panee cubes which are quoted with delicious masala. Loved it.

Next we were served with aloo dum biryani, the same flavourful rice’s served with big half cut boiled aloos & spicy masala.

I prefer paneer biryani over aloo dum biryani for sure.

While my friends are, I checked the other floors and washroom. The restaurant is really well maintained, good number of seating arrangements for the customer. The washroom was clean n hygienic too.

One of the best places for a budget friendly and tasty team dinners/ team lunches.

Author: Nirmala Pajaniradja
Review Text: Flabbergasted by their service n hospitality. Cleanliness at its best. We tried their signature meghna foods chicken biriyani and loved it. Chilli egg 🍛 was a big hit! Loved the side green sauce with the right proportion of tanginess. Raghuram, he delightfully served us food n made our experience a pleasant one. Thank you!

Author: Chiranjeevi
Review Text: I had a great experience with Meghana Foods! I ordered their Chicken Biryani Special for takeaway and it was absolutely delicious — full of flavor and perfectly cooked. What impressed me even more was how quickly they prepared my order I got it within just 5 minutes. The staff were also very helpful and polite, which made the whole experience even better.

Author: Chiithuzhiio Mao
Review Text: We tried the chicken biryani and it lived up to the hype. The rice was flavorful, the chicken was well-cooked and tender, and the spice level was just right. Portions were generous for its price. The place can get busy, but the service was quick.

Author: Prem
Review Text:
Meghana Foods - Koramangala

A Must-Visit for Biryani Lovers!
Parking space is limited and can be challenging to find.

- Delicious Andhra-style biryanis
- Tender and flavorful food
- Excellent service: attentive, polite, and welcoming
- Vibrant and family-friendly ambiance
- Quick service and efficient seating arrangement

Recommended Dishes:
- Veg Special Biryani
- Aloo Dum Biryani
- Paneer Biryani

Price is Affordable (₹370 for Meghana Special Biryani, serves 2)

A true gem for biryani enthusiasts! Consistently delivers on quality and flavor.

Author: Jaber M.
Review Text:
Meghana Foods is a good, no-frills restaurant. One thing that stands out right away is the hygiene. All the staff wear hair nets, which gives a lot of confidence that they take cleanliness seriously. It also explains their popularity, both in terms of the number of Google reviews and how busy the place gets.

I tried the Chicken Biryani and the Pepper Chicken Fry. The biryani was not really my style, but to be fair, it is because they serve the Andhra style, which is not my preference. They do have Hyderabadi biryani as well, for those who like that. On the other hand, the Pepper Chicken Fry was excellent. I finished it in no time, it was full of flavour and cooked just right.

The staff are very friendly and maybe a bit too attentive at times, but it adds to the overall positive experience. Both dishes were quite spicy, and I felt like cooling down with a cup of chai or filter coffee, but unfortunately, they only serve cold drinks.

Overall, it is a solid choice if you want straightforward food with good hygiene standards and welcoming service.

Author: K S Sai Prashanth
Review Text:
I ordered 2 special biryani and one boneless biryani
Quantity 10/10
Taste 10/10
Quality 10/10
Chicken 555 was outstanding😍
Chilly chicken was 🔥
The chicken starters are really worth it ! ❤️( For given money,quantity and taste
One biryani can easily serve two people

Author: Madhu Jaswal
Review Text:
Bahut ghatiya log hai 900 se upar le liya chicken special biryani mutton special biryani humne mangaya tha per hamare Sath froad Kiya Meghna special biryani pura payment le liya froad Kiya packing itna lock tha ki insanon per khol Kar dekh bhi Na sake fraud karne wali magnise special company ko phone kiya Kai bar unhone phone nahin uthaya taki unko Paisa na return karna pade ghatiya company ghatiya Meghna special biryani logon ke froad ki tarah loot Rahe log online bhi aur offline bhi

🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬
Owner Answer:
Dear Madhu,
We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and frustration you experienced with your recent order. This is not the standard of service we aim to provide, and we’re truly sorry that your expectations were not met. We take such concerns very seriously will escalate this to our management on top priority. Your feedback is valuable and helps us improve. We hope to have the opportunity to make things right and serve you better in the future.
Feel free to contact us for further queries.
Thank you again!
Meghana Foods.
+91 8123323836
Feedback@meghanafoods.co.in

Author: saish gaonkar
Review Text: Meghana Foods in Koramangala is well-known for its unique biryani presentation, where the flavorful masala (chicken or paneer) is layered on top of the rice. While their chicken biryani is undeniably delicious, the price point makes it a less accessible option for regular biryani cravings. The portion size is certainly adequate. Be prepared for crowds, especially on weekends and holidays during peak hours, as you'll likely encounter a wait.  On a separate occasion, I tried the Chicken 65, which was decent but nothing particularly memorable.  Overall, Meghana Foods offers a tasty biryani experience, but the pricing and potential wait times are factors to consider.

On a separate occasion, I tried the Chicken 65, which was decent but nothing particularly memorable. Author: Rafi
Review Text:
Meghna Foods in Sarjapur is a well-loved spot for those seeking flavorful, satisfying meals at reasonable prices. Known for its rich Indian and Andhra-style cuisine, the restaurant consistently delivers bold flavors and generous portions. Their biryanis are a standout — aromatic, perfectly spiced, and served with complementary sides like raita and salan. The Meghna Special Biryani, in particular, is a must-try for first-time visitors.

Beyond biryani, the menu offers a variety of curries, starters, and breads that cater to both vegetarian and non-vegetarian preferences. Items like their Butter Chicken, Andhra Chilli Chicken, and Guntur Chicken are particularly popular. The food is served hot and fresh, with an emphasis on authentic taste.

The ambience is simple yet comfortable, making it ideal for casual dining with family or friends. Service is usually prompt, although peak hours can lead to slight delays. The staff are courteous and attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience overall.

Meghna Foods also offers efficient takeaway and delivery services, which are widely appreciated in the Sarjapur area. For anyone craving hearty South Indian or spicy Andhra meals, Meghna Foods is a reliable and satisfying choice. It balances taste, quality, and value impressively well.

Author: Manaswita Sil
Review Text: My siblings and I had Meghana Special Biryani, which was strongly recommended by one of my Kannadiga friends. It was tasty, no doubt. But the showstopper was the starter named Chicken 555. It was superb. Tangy, spicy, flavorsome! Must try! The service and ambience were perfect.

Author: Devesh Toshniwal
Review Text: Meghana's is the place to go for Hyderabadi Biryani in Bangalore, hands down. Their biryani is the best, period. We got the Paneer Biryani, Paneer 65, and Potato Biryani. The place is awesome, the service is fast, and the food always tastes amazing 👍 👌🏽 😋 You gotta try it 💯

Author: Arava Ranjhitha
Review Text:
There's free parking available downstairs. The boneless chicken biryani was delicious, and the service was exceptional (10/10). I noticed a significant wait time on weekends, so I recommend arriving early to avoid the queue.

The security staff did an excellent job managing the seating arrangements. The tables were cleaned incredibly fast, allowing for quick turnover and minimizing wait times, which was truly impressive

Author: Harsh RJ
Review Text:
This is a good outlet for Meghana Foods located on Sarjapur road. The food is the same like the other outlets.
The service is good and you don't have to wait a lot for the food. The good point about this place is it has a good ambience and has seating capacity is enough so you will not have to usually wait for a table to get empty and then occupy it.
Overall a great place in Bangalore for delicious food.

Author: Ramesh Nonia
Review Text:
I've been a long-time fan of Meghana Foods and especially loved their Paneer Biryani. However, lately, the quality has noticeably declined. The biryani doesn’t taste as good as it used to, and the paneer has become tough and difficult to chew. It's disappointing to see such a beloved place lose its consistency.

Meghana Foods needs to take this feedback seriously and make efforts to improve the food quality again. If this continues, it could really impact their reputation and loyal customer base. I genuinely hope they bring back the same great taste and quality we once loved.

Author: nidhin sugunan
Review Text:
Ordered biryani from here for a Sunday brunch, but it turned out to be quite “mid.” I tried the Boneless Chicken Biryani, Meghana Special Biryani, and Chicken Biryani.

On the positive side, the packaging was neat, the quality was good, and the quantity was just right. The chicken pieces were tender, and the rice was flavorful. However, the downsides made it difficult to fully enjoy the meal. The masala in the Boneless Chicken Biryani was overly salty, while the Meghana Special had an overpowering eggy flavor in the masala, which was quite off-putting.

For a biryani that costs close to 400, I expected better. This inconsistency is exactly why I had stopped ordering from Meghana in the past. With so many great options available in Bangalore now, I find it hard to justify coming back unless they work on maintaining consistency.

Author: Battu Jeyavardhini
Review Text: We visited Meghana Foods last week, believe it or not, despite the prices, the food tastes so good. We ordered Chicken Fry Piece Biryani and Meghana Spl Biryani. Must try is Meghana Spl Biryani, it meets all the flavours that I ever tasted in Andhra. If you want to forget the budget for once in a week, you can visit Meghana Foods !!

Author: Manish सारस्वत
Review Text:
Okay, so I’m a vegetarian and never really vibed with veg biryani... but Meghna Food changed the game! Tried it here and wow—loved it. Totally worth giving it a shot. The quantity? Easily enough for two people, no kidding.

Also tried their Gobi Manchurian—crispy, tasty, and just hits right. The service was super nice too, especially for the price. And the place? Big, chill, and spacious. Great spot to just relax and enjoy some good food.

Veg or not, this place is def worth a visit!

Author: chidambarathanu
Review Text:
One of the best non-veg restaurants I’ve ever visited!
The food was absolutely mouth-watering—every dish was rich in flavor, perfectly cooked, and served fresh. From juicy kebabs to delicious curries, every bite was a delight for meat lovers.

The staff were polite, attentive, and made sure we had a comfortable dining experience. Service was quick, and they handled all our requests with a smile.

The ambiance was cozy and clean, making it a great spot for both families and friends. The menu had a wide variety of non-veg dishes, and everything we tried was top quality.

Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys great non-vegetarian food and top-notch service.

Review Text:

For a biryani that costs close to 400, I expected better. This inconsistency is exactly why I had stopped ordering from Meghana in the past. With so many great options available in Bangalore now, I find it hard to justify coming back unless they work on maintaining consistency.

Author: Battu Jeyavardhini
Review Text: We visited Meghana Foods last week, believe it or not, despite the prices, the food tastes so good. We ordered Chicken Fry Piece Biryani and Meghana Spl Biryani. Must try is Meghana Spl Biryani, it meets all the flavours that I ever tasted in Andhra. If you want to forget the budget for once in a week, you can visit Meghana Foods !!

Author: Manish सारस्वत
Review Text:
Okay, so I’m a vegetarian and never really vibed with veg biryani... but Meghna Food changed the game! Tried it here and wow—loved it. Totally worth giving it a shot. The quantity? Easily enough for two people, no kidding.

Also tried their Gobi Manchurian—crispy, tasty, and just hits right. The service was super nice too, especially for the price. And the place? Big, chill, and spacious. Great spot to just relax and enjoy some good food.

Veg or not, this place is def worth a visit!

Author: chidambarathanu
Review Text:
One of the best non-veg restaurants I’ve ever visited!
The food was absolutely mouth-watering—every dish was rich in flavor, perfectly cooked, and served fresh. From juicy kebabs to delicious curries, every bite was a delight for meat lovers.

The staff were polite, attentive, and made sure we had a comfortable dining experience. Service was quick, and they handled all our requests with a smile.

The ambiance was cozy and clean, making it a great spot for both families and friends. The menu had a wide variety of non-veg dishes, and everything we tried was top quality.

Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys great non-vegetarian food and top-notch service.

Author: Nayana J
Review Text: The dine in experience at Meghana Foods was really nice. Tried Chicken fry piece biryani, banjara chicken and Chilli guava mojito. The biryani was really tasty and the chicken pieces were cooked well.. the mojito was refreshing and starter was not up to the mark. Overall had a great dinner time.

Author: saish gaonkar
Review Text:
Meghana Foods Singasandra: Must-Try Boneless Biryani & Great Service!
Meghana Foods in Singasandra offers the convenience of parking right in front. Be prepared for a wait during peak hours, but the welcoming service makes it worthwhile. The seating is spacious, comfy, and ample for groups. The Boneless Chicken Biryani is a definite must-try here, featuring wonderfully soft biryani rice. Portions are generous, easily enough for two light eaters. The Chicken Legs and Pepper Chicken are also good options. While the menu is a little overpriced, it's generally reasonable given the quality.

Author: Aman Bhargava
Review Text:
Service is awesome, instant service food is awesome just like other franchise.
Boneless chicken biryani is must try. It is inside some hotel

Request to them to add Jackfruit biryani as well in the menu like others are offering

Author: bishal kumar
Review Text:
Awesome food. We went with family and loved it.
Edit: Visited again and had fish chilly, meghana biriyani, etc. good tasted

Author: Harsha Anjanappa
Review Text: It was quite crowded, as expected for a weekend lunch. We really enjoyed the authentic, soft biryani rice with paneer and aloo dum. The guava chili mojito was a great complement to the biryani. Plus, there was plenty of parking available…

Author: spoorthy devaiah
Review Text: To dine at Meghana Foods is an experience in itself. We had 10 mins of waiting line before we were led to a seat of 4 although we were 2 of us. Because of the queue, we thought they will make us dine with 2 other strangers in the same table but it wasn’t the case. We ordered Gobi 65 and it tasted really really good with mild flavours and no synthetic color whatsoever. Then arrived our boneless chicken biryani which was the star of the show. I felt the portion was large enough for 2 light eaters. Great experience all in all.

Author: Neeraj Soundararajan
Review Text:
I've been a loyal customer of Meghana Foods for the past 5 years, and I'm thrilled to say that I've never been disappointed with their service or quality!

While it's true that Meghana Foods is famous for its non-veg biryani options, I can confidently say that their veg biryani is equally delicious and satisfying.
Consistent Quality: Meghana Foods has maintained its high standards over the years, and I've never had a bad experience.
Moderate Pricing: Meals are reasonably priced between ₹200-₹400 per person.
Convenient Options: Enjoy their delicious biryani at home with delivery and takeaway options.
Ample Parking: No worries about parking; they have ample space available.
Efficient Seating: Even during crowded hours, the staff ensures a smooth seating arrangement.
If you're a biryani lover like me, look no further than Meghana Foods!

Author: MFJ
Review Text: As usual meghna the best.!!! ya food and service was top notch.. spicy delicious food.. huge place. Plenty of parking. Very nice ambience.  Amazing starters and biriyanis.

Author: Faraz Ahmed
Review Text: We loved the prawns Biryani and their signature chicken Biryani.. Paneer Biryani was above average as well.. Their starter chicken legs were lip smacking filled with juices and spiciness.. Their Biryani's are a bit on the spicy side especially the pieces of Biryani.. Service is top notch and Ambience is great with well lit and spacious comfy seats.. Parking available for around 6-8 cars.. We spent close to 2000 for 4 people which includes juice as well.. Enjoy your Biryani in good quality and quantity!!!

Author: Shaktimaya Sahoo
Review Text: Today I ordered Meghana special chicken biryani along with fry chicken biryani and found a feather of chicken. now I can imagine the level of hygiene you people are maintaining

Author: Nayana J
Review Text: The dine in experience at Meghana Foods was really nice. Tried Chicken fry piece biryani, banjara chicken and Chilli guava mojito. The biryani was really tasty and the chicken pieces were cooked well.. the mojito was refreshing and starter was not up to the mark. Overall had a great dinner time.

Portions are generous, easily enough for two light eaters. The Chicken Legs and Pepper Chicken are also good options. While the menu is a little overpriced, it's generally reasonable given the quality.

Author: Shaktimaya Sahoo
Review Text: Today I ordered Meghana special chicken biryani along with fry chicken biryani and found a feather of chicken. now I can imagine the level of hygiene you people are maintaining

Author: Jayesh Menon
Review Text:
Tried the much-talked-about Meghana Special Biryani today at Meghana Foods.
Being a fan of Hyderabadi-style biryani, I finally decided to see what the buzz was all about. I ordered their boneless Meghana Special Chicken Biryani along with a regular sweet lassi.

Portion size? Generous is an understatement. Easily enough for two people if paired with a starter or soup. I’m someone with a big appetite, and even I found it difficult to finish.
The flavor was good, the chicken was tender, and the spices were well-balanced. But somewhere along the way, probably due to the sheer quantity, the excitement wore off, and the meal started to feel a bit overwhelming. Add a full glass of lassi to that, and I was definitely stuffed.

Overall, it was good but didn’t quite live up to the hype I’ve often heard. Worth trying once for the experience and quantity, but personally, I wouldn’t place it as the absolute best biryani in Bangalore.

Author: Gaurav Bhatt
Review Text:
The food was reliably good, as always. We ordered Biryani, Chicken, and Butter Naan. The Biryani maintained its usual quality, the chicken was tasty, but the naan was paper thin. It would be better if the naan was more layered and slightly thicker.
Unfortunately, the service did not match the standard of the food. It took five minutes to get mint chutney after our initial request, despite our food being served ten minutes earlier. Additionally, we requested two glasses for a half bottle of Coke, but our request was ignored initially. After reminding the staff, one went to the manager but never returned, leaving us waiting fifteen minutes before another waiter finally provided the glasses. Such neglect for a customer is disappointing.
I strongly urge the restaurant to address these service issues to ensure that future customers have a consistently positive experience.
PS: The rating 2 star is solely because of the service.

Author: Sanjeev M
Review Text:
Advice:

1. Just take 1 biriyani if 2 people are going
2. Never order boneless chicken biriyani. The pieces are coated in batter and fried and then put as a gravy on top of the pile of biriyani rice. Very bad. Probably when you order normal biryani it comes with bone and there probably it's not put in a batter and fried.
3. It's so sad that chicken 65 is recommended but its not chicken 65 at all. The original is the one from Buhari hotel in Chennai and which is deep fried and red in colour and no batter. This one is again batter and not oil fried but cooked or something. Please rename it to something else.

Overall not very good. Will not go again.

Author: ronali priyadarshini
Review Text: Heard so much about this place. We tried there Hyderabadi biriyani. just delicious. Quality quantity and flavours outstanding. Service is good. Visit early or you have to wait for some time.. must try.

Author: The Bruh
Review Text: Went here to taste their special meghana biriyani. The b/l special biryani had ample pieces and quantity also was good . The flavour was subtle and can try once for the hype . Their special tandoori chicken was good but nothing as to be extraordinary. This hotel had large seating capacity and can accommodate more people

Author: Vidhyaa Dayanandh (Vidu)
Review Text: One of the unique biryani, you will get it nowhere else.. A little spicy and good for the quick lunch coz it’s crowded. We had ordered prawn biryani , chicken and mutton biryani and few starters.

Author: Pranav Kabade
Review Text: I had the best biryani experience at Meghana’s in Bengaluru. The flavors were rich, the spices perfectly balanced, and every bite felt authentic. Their Mushroom Biryani was a surprise hit—loaded with juicy mushrooms, spicy masala, and served with raita, it was super satisfying even without meat. Easily one of the most memorable biryanis I’ve had!

Author: nikhil raj
Review Text: Tasteful food, varieties and good staff....!! Going back again... my international friends lso liked the food..!!

Author: Divya Jindal
Review Text:
Ordered veg dum aloo biryani & there were prawns in the order I received. How irresponsible can this restaurant be? Feeding thousands of people are eating every single day.

There you just lost me as one of your customers and maybe many more vegetarians like me.

Author: shihab kottuvala
Review Text: Chicken boneless biryani is my favourite item. It's a little spicy, preparing in basmati rice. I recommend

Author: Jayesh Menon
Review Text:
Tried the much-talked-about Meghana Special Biryani today at Meghana Foods.
Being a fan of Hyderabadi-style biryani, I finally decided to see what the buzz was all about. I ordered their boneless Meghana Special Chicken Biryani along with a regular sweet lassi.

Portion size? Generous is an understatement. Easily enough for two people if paired with a starter or soup. I’m someone with a big appetite, and even I found it difficult to finish.

Unfortunately, the service did not match the standard of the food. It took five minutes to get mint chutney after our initial request, despite our food being served ten minutes earlier. I strongly urge the restaurant to address these service issues to ensure that future customers have a consistently positive experience.
PS: The rating 2 star is solely because of the service.

Advice:

1. Just take 1 biriyani if 2 people are going
2. Never order boneless chicken biriyani. The pieces are coated in batter and fried and then put as a gravy on top of the pile of biriyani rice. Very bad. Probably when you order normal biryani it comes with bone and there probably it's not put in a batter and fried.
3. It's so sad that chicken 65 is recommended but its not chicken 65 at all. The original is the one from Buhari hotel in Chennai and which is deep fried and red in colour and no batter. This one is again batter and not oil fried but cooked or something. Please rename it to something else.

Overall not very good. Will not go again.

Author: shihab kottuvala
Review Text: Chicken boneless biryani is my favourite item. It's a little spicy, preparing in basmati rice. I recommend

Author: Ananya N
Review Text: Meghana foods in Jayanagar is a go-to place for delicious food. The Biryanis are outstanding - aromatic, flavorful, and served in generous portions. The service is quick and the staff is polite, making the dining experience smooth even during rush hours. The place is well-maintained with a nice seating setup, perfect for both family outings and casual meals with friends. If you’re in Jayanagar and craving authentic spicy food, Meghana foods is definitely worth visiting. ✨

Author: shaswat patra
Review Text: If you are in Bangalore for a minimum of 1month then you must have heard about Meghana Biryani. The Biryani is not like Hyderabad Dum Biryani but its taste unique and tastes awesome. Tried Mutton Biryani this time and it turned out to be amazing. Everyone tries Meghana Spl Chicken Biryani but trust me try Mutton Biryani also its superb in taste. Little higher in Price but its worth if it.

Author: Manoj Manu
Review Text: In Jayanagar it's the best spot in MidNight Dinner and The food here is amazing. Service is also good. The staff are friendly. You will really enjoy the Biriyani's. I highly recommend.

Author: Harish H
Review Text: Today had been to Meghna foods for Lunch. Very much crowded. We ordered Hyderabadi chicken biryani and chicken bonless biryani along with kabab and chicken 65. The taste was good bit spicy. Ambience and service was tooo good. Bit costly. since it’s situated in the main road Parking is an issue.

Author: Chintan Mandagadde Nagappagowda
Review Text:
I’ve been a regular customer at Meghana Biryani, both at the Jayanagar 4th Block outlet and also in Koramangala. I usually come here for their Boneless Chicken Biryani – and I must say, the taste never disappoints. The biryani is rich in flavor, aromatic, and truly one of the best in Bengaluru. Ambience is also nice and welcoming, which makes it a good place for food lovers, especially those coming from different parts of India.

However, I’ve noticed something that I feel needs to be addressed. As a Kannadiga, I’ve often felt that the staff doesn’t treat local customers with the same warmth or respect as they do with North Indian visitors. It seems like the focus is more on those who tip well or speak in Hindi, and that really left me disappointed. We locals also come to enjoy good food and deserve to be treated with equal courtesy.

Also, while the food is undoubtedly good, the prices are quite high – not very budget-friendly for regular visits. A bit more value-for-money would make the experience much better.

Great food, but hoping the management improves in terms of service attitude and pricing.
Owner Answer:
Dear Chintan,
Thank you so much for being a loyal patron of Meghana Foods and for taking the time to share such detailed feedback. We're truly grateful for your continued support at both our Jayanagar 4th Block and Koramangala outlets.
It means a lot to hear that you enjoy our Boneless Chicken Biryani and find our ambience welcoming. We take great pride in offering rich, flavorful dishes that represent the best of Bengaluru’s culinary spirit. At the same time, we’re truly sorry to hear that your recent experience with our service left you feeling disappointed. We want every guest to feel equally valued and respected, regardless of language or background. Your feedback is being taken very seriously, and we will be addressing this internally to ensure our team reflects the warmth and inclusivity that Meghana Foods stands for. Could you please help us with your contact details so we can make this right for you. Or you could even contact us on the number given below.
Feel free to contact us for further queries.
Thank you again!
Meghana Foods.
+91 8123323836
Feedback@meghanafoods.co.in

Author: Krishna Chaitanya SVS
Review Text: In my opinion, the best Hyderabadi Biriyani in Bangalore. They've space on ground and first floors but always busy because of its popularity. One thing I noticed is that the quantity of food given when you dine-in seems less compared to when you order to home thru swiggy or other.

Author: G P
Review Text:
Tasted Meghana Biryani Since 2007 when they opened their first beach @ Koramangala,
Same taste nothing changed,
As usual their Meghana Spcl Biryani s Suprb,
And as well as their Paneer Biryani,
Chicken Ghee Roast Ultimate,
And their service are good,
Little crowded & Prominent Location @ Jayanagar.

Author: Niranjan MN
Review Text: Must try in Bangalore. Spicy and flavourful. The service and ambience is top notch. But definitely overpriced.

Author: Dr. Bibaswan Roy
Review Text:
Prominent location in indira nagar , bangalore. All the items are very very tasty. Specially the meghana special chicken biryani. The pieces are soft and delicious.
The lassi was so good.
Even the chocolate pan outside was so good.
Pretty much affordable too.
Three cheers for Meghana.
Highly recommended!!

Author: Ankitha Marnal
Review Text:
Extremely Disappointed and Shocked – Found Chicken in a Vegetarian Dish

I am a pure vegetarian and had ordered Veg Fried Rice and Chilli Paneer for dinner. To my absolute shock and horror, halfway through the meal, I discovered chicken pieces mixed in with the paneer. Thankfully, I noticed the difference before swallowing it—but the damage is already done.

This is not just a mistake; it’s a serious breach of trust, especially for someone who follows a strict vegetarian diet due to personal, ethical, or religious reasons. I am now questioning the kitchen’s hygiene, food segregation practices, and SOPs.

We pay a premium expecting safe, labelled food from a reputed brand, not to have our beliefs and preferences violated. To make things worse, no one from the restaurant has bothered to respond to my calls or messages. Swiggy said they are just a platform and restaurant should be contacted directly.

This kind of negligence is unacceptable. I hope appropriate action is taken and such incidents are not repeated with other customers.

Author: Ananya N
Review Text: Meghana foods in Jayanagar is a go-to place for delicious food. The Biryanis are outstanding - aromatic, flavorful, and served in generous portions. The service is quick and the staff is polite, making the dining experience smooth even during rush hours. The place is well-maintained with a nice seating setup, perfect for both family outings and casual meals with friends. If you’re in Jayanagar and craving authentic spicy food, Meghana foods is definitely worth visiting. ✨

Little higher in Price but its worth if it.

Dear Chintan,
Thank you so much for being a loyal patron of Meghana Foods and for taking the time to share such detailed feedback. We're truly grateful for your continued support at both our Jayanagar 4th Block and Koramangala outlets.
It means a lot to hear that you enjoy our Boneless Chicken Biryani and find our ambience welcoming. We take great pride in offering rich, flavorful dishes that represent the best of Bengaluru’s culinary spirit. At the same time, we’re truly sorry to hear that your recent experience with our service left you feeling disappointed. We want every guest to feel equally valued and respected, regardless of language or background. Your feedback is being taken very seriously, and we will be addressing this internally to ensure our team reflects the warmth and inclusivity that Meghana Foods stands for. Could you please help us with your contact details so we can make this right for you. Or you could even contact us on the number given below.
Feel free to contact us for further queries.
Thank you again!
Meghana Foods.
+91 8123323836
Feedback@meghanafoods.co.in
